identity.name: DevAI
identity.vibe: Elite, Tactical, High-Precision, Dark Mode First
identity.description: A command-center for software development. Dark, sleek, and distraction-free. It feels like a futuristic IDE, not a marketing site.

headings.usage: All section headers, hero titles, and modal titles.

code.usage: Code snippets, terminal outputs, commit hashes, branch names.

buttons.style: Sharp or slightly rounded (rounded-md). High contrast.

cards.style: Flat dark background (zinc-900) with 1px border (zinc-800). No heavy shadows.

inputs.style: Deep background (zinc-950), border zinc-800. Focus ring primary.

visual_enhancers.glassmorphism: Use sparingly. Only for sticky headers or floating action bars. backdrop-blur-xl bg-black/70 border-b border-white/10.
visual_enhancers.shadows: shadow-none or shadow-sm for depth. Avoid large drop shadows in dark mode.
visual_enhancers.textures: Subtle noise overlay on the main background to reduce banding.

instructions_to_main_agent: Implement the 'The Performance Pro' archetype: Dark, fast, and tactical.
Use 'Outfit' font for all headings. Import it from Google Fonts.
Use 'JetBrains Mono' for any code-related text (repo names, commits, terminal).
For the 'Projects List', use a dense grid layout (Mode B from guidelines).
For the 'Landing Page', use the 'Tetris' grid (Mode A) with the hero image provided.
Use 'react-icons' for all tech logos (GitHub, Laravel, Vue, Flutter) instead of images.
Ensure all interactive elements have 'data-testid' attributes.
Do NOT use gradients for text. Keep text solid white or gray for readability.
Customize Shadcn components to match the Zinc palette provided in 'colors'.
universal_guidelines: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients.
Don't make generic centered layouts. Use asymmetry.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur) for overlays.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable.
